content: easter eggs knitting pattern by kerry robb yarn four skeins rowan baby merino silk dk one in each color candy pink sunshine yellow iceburg aqua frosty lavender tools 32 circular needle size us 3 3 25mm * or double points one stitch marker tapestry needle enough wool stuffing for 4 eggs these charming eggs are a wonderful want the stitches to be fairly tight when way to celebrate easter knit seamlessly you add the stuffing the knitting will in the round from the top to the bottom stretch out considerably so be sure to they re a quick and fun knit make for a go down at least a few needle sizes than child s easter basket or for decorating you d usually use i ve called for size us 3 your home to celebrate spring s arrival needles you should use whichever size gives you nice firm stitches but not so *a note about gauge there is no set tight that your eggs are like little rocks gauge for this project but you definitely knit a circular swatch before you begin begin co 6 sts leaving a 12 tail join sts to work in the round i like to use knitting on for the co here you want a firm beginning for stitching up later place marker round 1 *kfb* around 12 sts round 2 knit round 3 *k2 m1r repeat from * to end of round 18 sts rounds 4 6 knit round 7 *k3 m1r repeat from * to end of round 24 sts rounds 8 10 knit round 11 *k4 m1r repeat from * to end of round 30 sts rounds 12 14 knit round 15 *k5 m1r repeat from * to end of round 36 sts rounds 16 22 knit note at this point i start stuffing the egg before beginning the decrease rounds don t over- stuff as it will make it difficult to knit the decreases if there s wool bits getting tangled up in your stitches as you knit the following rounds stop to add a bit more stuffing a couple of times so that by the end your egg is nearly full this helps to shape the egg as you go and it also prevents your having to try and stuff a full egg s worth of stuffing through six little stitches at the very end which is no fun at all trust me i speak from experience round 23 *k4 k2tog repeat from * around 30 sts round 24 knit round 25 *k3 k2tog repeat from * around 24 sts round 26 knit round 27 *k2 k2tog repeat from * around 18 sts round 28 knit round 29 *k1 k2tog repeat from * around 12 sts round 30 *k2tog* 6 sts finishing break yarn leaving a 12 tail and finish stuffing egg if needed thread tail through eye of a tapestry needle transfer remaining stitches to the tapestry needle pulling them tight i like to go through the last 6
